title: Ticket #6677: warning keyword doesn't work in submit file.
description:
When the warning keyword is used in a submit file, it generates a warning - but also causes a parse error on the queue statement. for example, this submit file 

subsleep (a submit file with warning)
executable = /bin/sleep
arguments = 180
warning : this is a warning
queue

causes this output 

$ condor_submit subsleep
Submitting job(s)
ERROR: on Line 4 of submit file: invalid queue statement.
Submit:-1:Error "subsleep", Line 3: cannot parse: warning : this is a warning
|Submit:0:Warning "subsleep", Line 3: this is a warning

ERROR: Failed to parse command file (line 98).
remarks:
2018-May-14 15:57:06 by johnkn:
test is needed

2018-Jul-27 11:09:56 by tim:
CODE REVIEW: Looks OK to me
